text: Decrease of NF-kappaB Activity in Tumor Tissue of <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - Mice
The activation of NF-kappaB plays a critical role in cancer cell survival , especially melanoma cancer cells and in <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .

To evaluate whether the tumor inhibition was related with the inactivation of NF-kappaB in melanoma , the DNA binding activity of NF-kappaB was determined by electromobility shift assay ( EMSA ) in melanoma tissue .
The constitutively activated DNA binding activity was reduced in the <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice tumor tissue ( Figure 2A ) .

Moreover , the translocation of <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and p - <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> into the nucleus through the inhibition of phosphorylation of IkappaB was also prevented in the tumor tissues of <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice ( Figure 2B ) .

Immunofluorescence analysis also confirmed that the intensity of nuclear staining for <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> had decreased in the tumor tissues of <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice ( Figure 2C ) .
